name: (C) ESTAR HP FS (RTU, NG Heat)
_description: ENERGY STAR air source heat pump (w/ cold climates specs as applicable) fully replacing original NG RTU equipment

notes: ENERGY STAR V. 4.0 went into effect in January 2023 as reflected under 2023 column. Ventilation savings are based on ComStock simulations of a variable speed HP RTU with energy recovery
savings are averaged across all states.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

installed_cost_source.notes: ENERGY STAR costs in 2023 normalized by capacity.
installed_cost_source.source_data: Buildings Annual Technology Baseline. NREL, forthcoming

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

market_scaling_fractions_source.notes: Heating multiple of 92% was determined by dividing square feet in which main heating equipment is gas packaged unit (14491406 sf) by square feet in shiwch main heating equipment is gas furnace or packaged unit (176461522 sf). Cooling equipment multiples determined by square feet in which given cooling system (e.g., RTAC, chiller) is pared with given heating system for the measure. Ventilation multiples determined by square feet in which given ventilation system (VAV or CAV) is paired with given heating system for the measure.
